wikipedia_page.main: Craig Sellar Lang (13 May 1891 – 24 Nov 1971) was a New Zealand-born British organist, composer and music teacher.

response: * Craig Sellar Lang: Two books of 24 preludes and fugues

Keys was born on 8 March 1919, the son of Christopher Richard Keys."Keys, Prof. Ivor Christopher Banfield", Who Was Who (online edition, Oxford University Press, December 2007). Retrieved 20 December 2018. Described as a "child prodigy",Basil Deane,"Obituary: Professor Ivor Keys", The Independent, 14 July 1995. Retrieved 20 December 2018. In 1934 Keys became the youngest Fellow of the Royal College of Organists while at school at Christ's Hospital; having already earned an ARCO diploma in 1933."Professor Ivor Keys", The Times (London), 17 July 1995, p. 21. There he was a pupil of Craig Sellar Lang. From 1936 through 1938 he studied at the Royal College of Music (RCM) with George Thalben-Ball.
